data.title: Adriana Totera on LinkedIn: Group projects are a rarity in law school, so when the opportunity arose…
data.meta_description: Group projects are a rarity in law school, so when the opportunity arose, I approached it with cautious optimism. However, what followed turned out to be one…
data.text: Group projects are a rarity in law school, so when the opportunity arose, I approached it with cautious optimism. However, what followed turned out to be one of the most enriching experiences of my academic journey. Teaming up with my colleagues Nicole Paladino and Ajman Ladher, we embarked on the ambitious task of developing Pivot Software, a cutting-edge file management system poised to revolutionize Ontario's tribunal system. Our collaboration transcended mere academic exercise; it became a testament to the power of teamwork and collaboration within the legal profession. As we delved deeper into the project, it became increasingly clear that success in law extends beyond individual brilliance; it hinges on effective collaboration and collective effort. Through our endeavours, I not only deepened my understanding of legal technology but also honed essential skills in teamwork and project management. The project served as a representation of the legal world, where effective collaboration is paramount in balancing client needs and business priorities. Undoubtedly, our journey was fraught with challenges and sleepless nights, yet it was also punctuated by moments of camaraderie, laughter, and intellectual discourse. These experiences left a mark on my memory, reinforcing my belief in the transformative potential of collaborative efforts within the legal realm. Thank you Suresh Sriskandarajah JD, MBA, PEng ! Here is a short clip of the presentations from JUR 209.
